text: Donald Watson (2 September 1910 â€“ 16 November 2005) was an English woodwork teacher who made the word 'vegan'. He started the Vegan Society in 1944. In 1924, Watson saw a pig being killed on his uncle's farm. After this he became a vegetarian. He was fourteen years old. When Watson was fifteen he left school to be an apprentice woodworker.
